meanings.definition: A person or thing that is missed or left out.
meanings.sent1: The teacher always makes sure to include everyone in the game, so there are no missouts.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a missouts when her friends went to the movies without inviting her.
meanings.sent3: The birthday cake felt like a missouts when the candles forgot to be lit.
meanings.sent4: The lonely teddy bear on the shelf seemed like a missouts among all the other toys.
meanings.sent5: The lost puppy looked like a missouts until the kind family took him in.

meanings.definition: To fail to include or mention something.
meanings.sent1: Don't missouts any important details when you tell the story.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally missouts the last step in the recipe, and the cake didn't turn out right.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried not to missouts any clues during the investigation.
meanings.sent4: Her speech felt incomplete because she missouts the key point.
meanings.sent5: It's easy to missouts small errors when proofreading your essay.

meanings.definition: To fail to attend or be present at an event or meeting.
meanings.sent1: I can't believe I missouts the concert last night; I heard it was amazing.
meanings.sent2: She had to missouts the important meeting due to a sudden illness.
meanings.sent3: The cat pretended to missouts the vet appointment by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: He regretted having to missouts the family reunion because of work.
meanings.sent5: The student didn't want to missouts the field trip to the zoo.
